alert.note: Alert for Mecklenburg (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 10:29PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Mecklenburg County through 1115 PM EDT... At 1029 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Boydton, or 13 miles southwest of South Hill, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chase City, Clarksville, Boydton, Spanish Grove, Beechwood, John H Kerr Dam, Finchley, Skipwith, Rogers Corner, Bracey, Keats, Eppes Fork, John H Kerr Reservoir, Baskerville, Palmer Springs and Lake Gaston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. If you are on or near Kerr Reservoir, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike more than 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to a safe shelter. Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
